subject   : A LIFE-AND-DEATH ISSUE (read Ps. 90:1-10
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Sat, 3 Aug 2019 18:52:27 -0500

*Verse for 8/4/19:*
*Our days may come to seventy years, or eighty, if our strength endures;*
*yet the best of them are but trouble and sorrow, for they quickly pass,*
*and we fly away. *(Ps. 90:10)
*Thought for Today:*
Like people since Adam and Eve, we suffer the effects of sin, and death
is certain (Ro. 6:23). Yet we can live with hope and joy, because God sent
His Son to die for our sins. Jesus conquered death when He rose from the
grave. And if we receive Him as our personal Savior and Lord, we too can
experience God's forgiveness and look forward to being with Him in heaven
for ever. *Have you faced and settled this life-and-death issue?*
* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Like people since Adam and Eve, we suffer the effects of sin, and death
is certain (Romans 6:23). Yet we can live with hope and joy, because God sent
His Son to die for our sins. Jesus conquered death when He rose from the
grave. And if we receive Him as our personal Savior and Lord, we too can
experience God's forgiveness and look forward to being with Him in heaven
for ever. Have you faced and settled this life-and-death issue?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the brevity and frailty of our earthly lives. Like the generations before us, we too face the consequences of sin and the certainty of death. Yet, we are filled with hope, for You have sent Your Son, Jesus, to conquer sin and death on our behalf. We give thanks for His sacrifice and the promise of eternal life with You. May we live each day in the light of Your grace, finding joy and purpose in serving You. In the name of our risen Savior, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Like people since Adam and Eve, we suffer the effects of sin, and death is certain (Romans 6:23). Yet we can live with hope and joy, because God sent His Son to die for our sins. Jesus conquered death when He rose from the grave. And if we receive Him as our personal Savior and Lord, we too can experience God's forgiveness and look forward to being with Him in heaven forever. Have you faced and settled this life-and-death issue?
subject: A Life-And-Death Issue

*Verse for 8/5/19:*
*Satisfy us. . .With Your unfailing love, that we may sing for joy and*
*be glad All our days. *(Ps. 90:14)
*Thought for Today:*
We call Life's older years the "sunset years." *Or* "the golden years." For
some
they are. But for many others, even Christians, the "sunset years" often
turn into
bitterness and despair. As I have noticed contented older people, I have
learned
that it is our focus more than our feelings that determine the sort of
people we are.
One time an elderly lady told me that "old age is not for sissies!." But
her groans
turned into praise for God. What is your focus today, regardless of your
feelings?
Is it one of gratitude for Jesus and His gift of eternal life? If so,
you'll grow sweeter
as you grow older. *What you will be tomorrow depends on the choices you*
*make today.*
*Pastor Al*

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that the days of our lives are in Your hands. As we face the challenges of aging, help us to fix our eyes on the eternal hope found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Grant us the wisdom to see that our focus, more than our feelings, determines the kind of people we become. May our groans turn to praise as we grow sweeter in Your presence. Guide us to make choices today that will shape us into vessels of Your grace, even in our sunset years. Amen.

*Verse for 8/6/19:*
*Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow*
*of the Almighty.* (Ps. 91:1)
*Thought for Today:*
The phone numbers 9-1-1 in the United Sates will get you in touch with
emergency help. Its so simple even preschoolers know what it is for, and
how to use it. Often many situations we find ourselves in cannot be remedied by human resources. Many of our crises require divine assistance.
When that happens, we can call a different kind of 9-1-1 ---
Psalm 91:1. There we will find the help and protection of the Almighty God.
When we face the crises of life, we often try to survive on our own. We
forget that what we need most, is God's protection and the comfort of His
presence, which are available for the asking. *We need not faer life's dark
shadows when we abide under the shadow of God's wings.*
* Pastor Al*

Just as Psalm 91:1 promises, we find refuge under the shadow of Your wings. When we are overwhelmed by the darkness of this world, remind us to call upon Your name and abide in Your presence. May we always remember that You are our 911, our ever-present help in times of trouble. We trust in Your unfailing love and faithfulness. Amen.

*Verse for 8/7/19*
*They will still bear fruit in old age, they will stay fresh and green. *(Ps.
92:14)
*Thought for Today:*
A familiar saying goes something like this: "Old age is a matter of mind
over
matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter!" Dr's. tell us to stay active
as long
as we can. but far to many folks hit middle age and put the body in
neutral.
It seems that many Christians too often put their service for Jesus Christ
in
the same inactive mode. Each of us has a responsibility to God, as long as
He gives us physical and mental strength, to work heartily "as working for
the
Lord" (Col. 3:23). The Psalmist said that the righteous "will still bear
fruit in old
age" (Ps. 92:14). *Lets make sure that old age doesn't stop us from bearing*
*fruit. We need to keep going for God.*
* Pastor Al*

Lord, may we never grow weary in doing good, but continue to serve You faithfully and fruitfully all the days of our lives. Help us to stay active and engaged in Your work, not putting our service for You in neutral. May we bear abundant fruit for Your glory, even in our later years. Amen.

*Subject: **THE TRUE OWNER* (read Ps. 95:1-7)

*Verse for 8/8/19:*
*All thing have been created through Him and for Him.*
(Col. 1:16)
*Thought for Today:*
It is easy to take for granted all the material and spiritual blessing
that God has given us. That's why we need to stop and remember that
Scripture says the true owner of all we possess is God's: "*Everything in
heaven and earth is yours. Yours, Lord, is the kingdom: You are exalted as
head over all" * (1 Cor. 29:11). Even our bodies do not belong to us. You
are not your own; you were bought with a price. We are so abundantly
blessed with good thing! Let us *never* take our heavenly Father for
granted, but use wisely and gratefully all that He has given us. *God gives
blessings to us so we can give glory to Him.*
* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:

us. You are not your own; you were bought with a price. We
are so abundantly blessed with good thing! Let us never take

gratefully all that He has given us. God gives blessings to
us so we can give glory to Him.
original_verse_text: All thing have been created through Him and for Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have and all we are belong to You. You are the Creator of all things, the true owner of all we possess. Help us to never take Your abundant blessings for granted, but to use them wisely and gratefully, giving glory to Your name. May we worship and serve You with joyful hearts, for You are our God and we are the people of Your pasture, the flock under Your care. Amen.
reflection: It is easy to take for granted all the material and spiritual blessings that God has given us. That's why we need to stop and remember that Scripture says the true owner of all we possess is God's: “Everything in heaven and earth is yours. Even our bodies do not belong to us. “You are not your own; you were bought with a price.” We are so abundantly blessed with good things! Let us never take our heavenly Father for granted, but use wisely and gratefully all that He has given us. God gives blessings to us so we can give glory to Him.

*Subject: ONLY FOR HIM *(read Ps. 95)

*Verse for 8/9/19:*
*I will sacrifice a thank offering to You and call on the name of the*
*Lord. *(Ps. 116:17)
*Thought for Today:*
Many think our Godward actions such as: prayer, singing, worship and
reading Scriptures,
are done as safety devices to prevent the Lord from zapping us. When we
think of God
that way, we will have wrong motives for any God-directed action. That kind
of thinking
leads us to pray and worship God for personal gain or approval. Our worship
of the Lord
is not done so we can somehow benefit. Instead, every heavenward thought or
action
should be done out of honor for Him and His greatness. *Sure,* we benefit
when we turn
our attention to God, but that should not be our motivation. *It is not*
for us we worship
God. It should always be for Him. *We don't worship God to gain His
benefits--we *
*already have them.*
* Pastor Al*

*Today's Subject: *
*MAKE A JOYFUL SHOUT* (read Ps. 100)

*Today's Verse:*
*Shout for joy to the Lord, all the earth.* (Ps.100:1)

*Today's Thought:*
The songwriter of Ps. 100 took his allegiance to the Lord seriously and
wanted others to do the same. When we were kids, we were told to sit still
and be quiet in church. (right?) *But,* God's goodness and grace should
motivate us to freely express *our* love and allegiance *to* the Lord. We
need to push back the boundaries of restraint and lean what is means to be
expressive in our praise to God. *Worship is a time to focus on our
Creator, Redeemer, and Shepherd, and celebrate what He has done for us.*
* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
The songwriter of Psalm 100 took his allegiance to the Lord
seriously and wanted others to do the same. When we were
kids, we were told to sit still and be quiet in church.
(right?) But, God's goodness and grace should motivate us to
freely express our love and allegiance to the Lord. We need
to push back the boundaries of restraint and lean what is
means to be expressive in our praise to God. Worship is a
time to focus on our Creator, Redeemer, and Shepherd, and
celebrate what He has done for us.
original_verse_text: Shout for joy to the Lord, all the earth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with joyful hearts, ready to make a joyful noise unto You. Your goodness and grace have overwhelmed us, and we long to express our love and allegiance to You freely. Help us to push back the boundaries of restraint and lean into what it means to be expressive in our praise. May our worship be a time to focus solely on You, our Creator, Redeemer, and Shepherd, and to celebrate all that You have done for us. Amen.
reflection: The songwriter of Psalm 100 took his allegiance to the Lord seriously and wanted others to do the same. When we were kids, we were told to sit still and be quiet in church. (Right?) But God's goodness and grace should motivate us to freely express our love and allegiance to the Lord. We need to push back the boundaries of restraint and learn what it means to be expressive in our praise to God. Worship is a time to focus on our Creator, Redeemer, and Shepherd, and celebrate what He has done for us.
subject: Make a Joyful Shout
verse_text: Shout for joy to the Lord, all the earth.

*Devotion for *(8/11/19)

*Today's Verse:*
*He will respond to the prayer of the destitute;*
*He will not despise their plea. *(Ps. 102:17)

*Today's Thought:*
The writer of Psalm 102 Knew the importance of prayer. He knew that God
cares for us and wants to hear from us, so start something new and take at
least five minutes each morning asking for His blessings on the day. The
Lord wants to hear from you in your destress. *Your new rule* just may have
a big impact on your family or someone close to you. *(remember) Prayer is
an acknowledgement of our need for God.*
* Pastor Al*

As the psalmist reminds us, You hear the cries of the afflicted and do not despise their prayers. Lord, we lift up our petitions to You, trusting that You will respond with compassion and grace. May our time in Your presence each morning be a source of strength, comfort, and direction for the day ahead. We surrender ourselves to Your will, knowing that Your love and faithfulness are ever-present. Amen.
reflection: The writer of Psalm 102 knew the importance of prayer. He knew that God cares for us and wants to hear from us, so start something new and take at least five minutes each morning asking for His blessings on the day. *Devotion for 8/12/19: (read Ps. 103:1-12)*

Today's Verse:
*As far as the east is form the west, so far He has*
*removed our transgressions from us. (Ps. 103:12)*

Today's Thought:
*The east and west can never meet. This is a symbolic *
portrait of God's forgiveness. When He forgives our sin, He separates it
from us and doesn't even remember it. We need not wallow in the ugly past,
because God forgives and forgets. How often have we dredge up the past? But
why, remember God has wiped our record clean. If we intend to follow God, we
must model His forgiveness. *When we **forgive others,** we must **also
forget the sin, otherwise **we have **not truly **forgiven.*
*Pastor Al*

*I do not know why this goofy computer decide to print in bold letters. . .*

subject   : Today's Subject: BEWARE OF QUICK FIXES (Ps. 106:1-15)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 13 Aug 2019 19:38:31 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Verse for Today:*
*But they soon forgot what they had done and did not wait for His plan to
unfold. *(Ps. 106:13)

*Thought for Today:*
How many of us have been guilty of praying only in a crisis. How many of us
have a *"Quick fix" *mentality that sees God mainly as a problem solver.
*And* when merciful solutions come, He is courteously thanked, then more
or less forgotten until the next crisis. If you read Psalm 106: 1-15 you
will see that it contains a serious warning against dismissing God from our
lives--as if that was possible. Anticipate great things from God, but don't
expect Him to come at your beck and call. *Instead, *be at His beck and
call, eager to fulfill His will. Ask God to accompany you through life's
dark pathways. *But* instead of dismissing Him when your special needs are
met, cling to Him as if your life depended on it. *It does! REMEMBER GOD
IS NOT A VENDING MACHINE. . .*
* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
How many of us have been guilty of praying only in a crisis.
How many of us have a "Quick fix" mentality that sees God
mainly as a problem solver. And when merciful solutions
come, He is courteously thanked, then more or less forgotten

see that it contains a serious warning against dismissing
God from our lives--as if that was possible. Anticipate
great things from God, but don't expect Him to come at your
beck and call. Instead, be at His beck and call, eager to
fulfill His will. Ask God to accompany you through life's
dark pathways. But instead of dismissing Him when your
special needs are met, cling to Him as if your life depended
on it. It does! REMEMBER GOD IS NOT A VENDING MACHINE. . .
original_verse_text:
But they soon forgot what they had done and did not wait for
His plan to unfold.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that we have been guilty of forgetting You, seeking You only in times of crisis and treating You as a mere problem-solver. Forgive us for our fickle hearts and our tendency to dismiss You once our immediate needs are met. Lord, help us to anticipate Your great works, to be at Your beck and call, and to cling to You as the very source of our life. May we not take Your presence for granted, but may we walk faithfully with You through all of life's journeys. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: How many of us have been guilty of praying only in a crisis? How many of us have a “quick fix” mentality that sees God mainly as a problem solver? And when merciful solutions come, He is courteously thanked, then more or less forgotten until the next crisis. If you read Psalm 106:1-15, you will see that it contains a serious warning against dismissing God from our lives—as if that was possible. Anticipate great things from God, but don't expect Him to come at your beck and call. Instead, be at His beck and call, eager to fulfill His will. Ask God to accompany you through life's dark pathways. But instead of dismissing Him when your special needs are met, cling to Him as if your life depended on it. It does! REMEMBER, GOD IS NOT A VENDING MACHINE.
subject: Beware of Quick Fixes
verse_text:
But they soon forgot what they had done and did not wait for
His plan to unfold.

*Today's Verse: *
*For You make me glad by Your deeds, Lord; I sing for joy*
*at what Your hands have done. *(Ps. 92:4)
*Today's Thought:*
I've always thought you can see the hand of God best with
our hindsight. Looking back it is easier to understand why He
placed us in the home that He did; why He brought certain
people and circumstances into and out of our lives. In my own
life, I get a lot of clarity (though not perfect) about the wise and
loving ways of God as I reflect on the ways He has managed my journey by
"What God's have done" (Ps. 92:4). Looking ahead,
though, is not always so clear. Have you ever had that lost feeling
when the road ahead seems twisted, foggy and scary? Before you
move into life's next big adventure, stop and look into the rear view
mirror of days gone by, and joyfully realize that God meant it when
He said, "Never will I leave you, never will I forsake you." So we can say
with confidence, "The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid"
(Heb. 13:5-6) *With the promise of God's presence and help in mind, we can
move ahead with utmost confidence.*
* Pastor Al *

*Today's Verse:*
*Even in darkness light dawns for the upright, f**or *
*those who are gracious and compassionate and*
*righteous. *(Ps. 112:4)
*Today's Thought:*
God lights our path when we trust Jesus as our
Savior. This trust may come through a word of
exhortation from a fellow believer. It may be the
illumination of God's Word by the ministry of the
Holy Spirit. It may be the calm reassurance in
response to heart felt prayer. Or it may be the
miraculous supply of a special need. Whatever
the case, God sends light when we are engulfed
in darkness. *Jesus lights the way in the darkest*
*night.*
* Pastor Al*

Even in darkness light dawns for the upright, for those who
are gracious and compassionate and righteous.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the light of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who illuminates our path and guides us through the darkness of this world. When we are engulfed in uncertainty and struggle, may we trust in Your steadfast love and find comfort in the reassurance of Your Word. Send Your Holy Spirit to minister to our hearts, that we may walk in the light of Your truth and find refuge in Your eternal presence. We thank You for the encouragement and exhortation of fellow believers, who point us to the Light of the world. May we ever abide in Your light and radiate Your glory. Amen.

*Today's Verse:*
*Their idols are sliver and Gold, mad by human hands.*
(Ps. 115:4)
*Today's Thought's*
Many things strive for our affection, and time, and attention,
and it seems we continually need to evaluate where we're
focusing our lives. Because of this God's people are exhorted
to find their security in Him and not other gods (Jug. 18:13-16).
Jesus reiterated this in His discussion of the commandments:
*"Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your *
*soul and all your mind"* (Mt. 22:37). The Lord alone is our
*"help and shield" * (Ps. 115:9). *May we reserve our worship *
*for Him. God is most worthy of our affection.*
* Pastor Al *
original_reflection_text:

soul and all your mind" (Matthew 22:37). The Lord alone is our

for Him. God is most worthy of our affection.
original_verse_text: Their idols are sliver and Gold, mad by human hands.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that You alone are worthy of our worship and affection. Help us to turn away from the false gods and idols that seek to captivate our hearts and minds. May our love for You be steadfast, and may we find our security and help in You alone, as Your Word declares. Strengthen our resolve to love You with all our heart, soul, and mind, for You are the one true God, deserving of our utmost devotion. Amen.

Because of this, God's people are exhorted to find their security in Him and not other gods (Judg. 18:13-16). The Lord alone is our “help and shield” (Psalm 115:9). May we reserve our worship for Him. God is most worthy of our affection.

*Today’s Subject: THANKFUL RESPONSE *(read Ps. 116)



*Today’s Verse:*

*I love the Lord because He hears and answers my prayers.*

*Because He bends down and listens, I will pray as long as*

*I have breath. *(Ps. 116:1-2)



*Today’s Thought:*

God is so responsive that you can always reach Him. He

bends down and listens to your voice. This writer’s love

for the Lord had grown because he had experienced

answers to his prayers. If you are discouraged, remember

that God is near, listening carefully to every prayer and

answering each one in order to give you *His best*.

*Worship is a thankful response and not a repayment*

*For what God has done.*

* Pastor Al*

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You have heard our voices and responded to our cries. Your love and faithfulness have sustained us, and we are in awe of Your constant presence in our lives. Lord, help us to always remember that You are near, listening intently to our prayers and working to provide us with Your perfect plan. May our worship be a sincere expression of thanksgiving, not a repayment, but a joyful acknowledgment of Your goodness. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

*Today’s Subject: MAKE IT STICK*—(read Ps. 119:9-16)



*Today’s Verse:*

*I have hidden your Word in my heart, that I may not*

*sin against You. *(Ps. 119:11)



*Today’s Thought:*

To *hide *means to *keep*. God’s Word in our heart is

a deterrent to sin. This alone should inspire us to

memorize Scriptures. But memorization alone will

not keep us from sin; we must also put it to work

in our life; making it a vital guide to everything we

do. *To get ahold of Scripture, let Scripture get ahold*

*of you.*

* Pastor Al* (8/21/19)
original_reflection_text:

deterrent to sin. This alone should inspire us to memorize
Scriptures. But memorization alone will not keep us from
sin; we must also put it to work in our life; making it a
vital guide to everything we do. To get ahold of Scripture,
let Scripture get ahold of you.

Help us to not only memorize Your Scriptures, but to make them a vital guide in our lives, allowing Your truth to take hold of us and transform us. May we delight in Your Word, meditating on it day and night, that we may walk in Your ways and bring glory to Your name. In Jesus' name, Amen.

*Today’s Subject: TRUE ROAD MAP *(read Ps. 119:12-24)



*Today’s Verse: *(8/22/19)

*I am but a foreigner here on earth; I need the guidance of *

*Your **commands. Don’t hide them from me! *(Ps. 119:19)



*Today’s Thoughts:*

The psalmist said that he is a “*foreigner here on earth”*

and so he needed guidance. Almost any long trip needs

a map or a guide. As we travel through life, the Bible

should be our road map, pointing out safe routes and

obstacles to avoid and our final destination. We must

recognize ourselves as pilgrims, travelers here on earth

who need to study God’s map to learn the way.

*If we ignore the map we will wonder aimlessly through *

*life and risk missing our real destination.*

* Pastor Al *

destination.

Guide us, we pray, through the pages of Your living Word, that we may discern the safe path and avoid the pitfalls that would lead us astray. May we ever recognize ourselves as pilgrims, dependent upon Your perfect map to reach our final destination. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord Himself watches over you! The Lord stands*

*beside you as your protective shade. *(Ps. 121:5)

*Today’s thoughts:*

This psalm expresses assurance and hope in God’s

protection day and night. He not only made the hills,

but heaven and earth as well. We should never trust

a lessor power than God Himself. But not only is He

all-powerful, He also watches over us. Nothing diverts

or deters Him, we are safe.* We never outgrow our *

*need for God’s unfailing watch over us.*

* Pastor Al*

day and night. He not only made the hills, but heaven and
earth as well. We should never trust a lessor power than God
Himself. But not only is He all-powerful, He also watches
over us. Nothing diverts or deters Him, we are safe. We
never outgrow our need for God’s unfailing watch over us.

you as your protective shade.

As we journey through life, we find comfort in the truth that You, the Maker of heaven and earth, are ever watchful over us, guarding our steps day and night. May we never put our trust in lesser powers, but instead, cling to the assurance that Your watchful care never slumbers nor sleeps. Lord, we thank You for Your unwavering presence and the security we find in Your divine protection. Amen.

*Today’s Verse: *

*Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. May all who love this*

*city prosper. *(Ps. 122:6)



*Today’s Thought:*

The psalmist was not praying for his own peace and

prosperity, but that of his brothers and friends in

Jerusalem. This is intercessory prayer, prayer on behalf

of others. Too often we are quick to pray for our own

needs and desires but neglect interceding for others.

*Will you intercede for someone in need today?*

* Pastor Al *

*Subject for *(8/25/19) *EVERLASTING ENDURANCE *(read Ps. 125)



*Today’s verse:*

*Those who trust in the Lord are as secure as mount Zion,*

*They will not be defeated but will endure forever. *(Ps. 125:1)



*Today’s Thought:*

Have you ever known people who were drawn to every new

fad or idea? Such people are unstable and unreliable. The

secret to reliability *is* trusting in God, because He never

changes. He cannot be shaken by the changes in our world,

and He endures forever. The fads and ideas of our world, and

our world itself, will not. *Remember the secret to reliability. *

*Pastor Al*

May our lives be anchored in Your word, that we may stand firm and unshakable, just as Psalm 125 declares. We praise You, Lord, for Your enduring faithfulness. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Those who plant in tears will harvest with shouts of joy.*

(Ps. 126:5)



*Today’s Thought:*

God’s ability to restore life is beyond our understanding.

Forests burn down and are able to grow back. Broken bones

heal. Even grief is not a permanent condition. Our tears

can be seeds that will grow into a harvest of joy because

God is able to bring good out of tragedy. When burdened

by sorrow, know that your times of grief will end and that

you, will again find joy. So let us pray for patients as well

as the ability to wait. *God’s great harvest of joy is coming!*

* Pastor Al*

Help us to wait patiently, knowing that Your great harvest is coming. May we cling to the hope found in Your Word, that those who sow in tears will reap with songs of joy. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Unless the Lord builds a house, the work of the builders is*

*useless. Unless the Lord protects the city, guarding it with*

*sentries will do no good. *(Ps. 127:1, 2)



*Today’s Thought:*

A family without God can never experience the spiritual

bond God brings to relationships. A city without God will

crumble from evil and corruption from the inside. Don’t

make the mistake of leaving God out of your life. If you

do, all your accomplishments will be futile. *Make God *

*your highest priority, and let Him do the building.*

* Pastor Al *

*Subject for 8/28/19 *GOD IS THE TRUE HEAD OF THE HOME (read Ps. 128:1-8)



*Today’s Verse: *

*How happy are those who fear the Lord—all who follow His ways!*

(Ps. 128:1)



*Today’ Thoughts:*

In this chapter the Psalmist writes that a good family life is a reward for

following God. The values outlined in God’s Word include, love, service,

honesty, integrity, and prayer. These help all relationships, and they are

especially vital to the home life. Is your home life heavenly or hectic?

Reading and obeying God’s Word is a good place to start to make your

family all that is should be. *God will reward your devotion to Him with *

*inner peace.*

* Pastor Al*

*Verse for Today:*

*Let Israel now say—from my earliest youth my enemies have *

*persecuted me. But they have never been able to finish me off.*

(Psalm 129:2)



*Today’s Thought:*

The people of Israel were persecuted from their earliest days

but never destroyed completely. The same is true of the church.

Christians have faced times of severe persecution, but the church

has never been destroyed. As Jesus said to Peter, “Now I say to

you that you are Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church,

and all the powers of hell will not conquer it.” (Mt. 16:18) When

You face persecution and discrimination take courage—The church

will never be destroyed.

*Remember—God will bring us through the tough times.*

* Pastor Al*

When we face discrimination and trials, grant us the courage to stand firm in our faith, knowing that You will bring us through the tough times. May we always remember that our hope is in You, the unshakable foundation of Your Church. Amen.

*Verse for Today:*

*Lord, if You kept a record of sins, who, O Lord, could ever survive?*

*But you offer forgiveness, that we might learn to fear. *(Ps. 130:3-4)



*Thought for Today:*

Keeping a record of sins (or holding a grudge) is like building a wall

between you and another person, which makes it nearly impossible to

talk openly while the wall is there. God doesn’t keep a record of our

sins; when He forgives, He forgives completely, tearing down any wall

between Him and us. So, we fear (revere) God, making it possible to talk

to Him about anything. When you pray, realize God is holding nothing

against you. *His lines of communication are completely open.*

* Pastor Al*

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that we have fallen short and sinned against You. Yet, we are in awe of Your boundless mercy and grace, for You do not keep a record of our transgressions. You have torn down the wall that once stood between us, opening the lines of communication so that we may approach You freely. Lord, we revere You and seek to walk in Your ways, knowing that Your forgiveness is complete and Your love is unfailing. Amen.

*Verse for Today:*

*Lord, my heart is not proud; my eyes are not haughty. I don’t*

*concern myself with matters to great or awesome for me. But*

*I have stilled and quietened myself, just as a small child is*

*quiet with his mother. Yes, like a small child is my soul within*

*me. *(Ps. 131:1-2)



*Thought for Today:*

Pride results from overvaluing ourselves above others.

It results in restlessness because it makes us dissatisfied

with what we have and concerned about what everyone

else is doing. It keeps us hungering for what others have.

By contrast, humility puts others first and allows us to be

content with God leading our lives. Such contentment

gives us security so that we no longer need to prove our-

selves to others.

*Let humility and trust affect your perspective **and give*

*you the strength and freedom to **serve God and others.*

* Pastor Al*

don’t concern myself with matters to great or awesome for
me. But I have stilled and quietened myself, just as a small
child is quiet with his mother. Yes, like a small child is
my soul within me. (Psalm 131:1-2) - (read Psalm 131)

Lord, my heart is not proud; my eyes are not haughty. I
don’t concern myself with matters to great or awesome for
me. But I have stilled and quietened myself, just as a small
child is quiet with his mother. Yes, like a small child is
my soul within me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that our ways are not as high as Yours. Help us to surrender our pride and not concern ourselves with matters too great for us. Instead, may we find rest and peace in Your presence, like a child resting securely in the arms of a loving parent. Quiet our souls and fill us with Your perfect peace, that we may trust in Your sovereign plan. Amen.

VERSE FOR 8:2:19:

_For the Lord God is a sun and a shield; the Lord bestows _

_favor and honor; no good thing does He withhold from _

_those whose walk is blameless. _(Ps. 84:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I prefer sunny days, but I am not a sun-worshiper. Instead,

I'm a worshiper of God's Son, who shines brightly in all

who believe in Him what ever the weather. Which kind of

worshiper are you? LASTING HAPPINESS DOESN'T COME FROM

SUNNY DAYS BUT FROM THE SON OF GOD.

_PASTOR AL_

original_verse_text: For the Lord God is a sun and a shield; the Lord bestows favor and honor; no good thing does He withhold from those whose walk is blameless.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our lasting joy and fulfillment do not come from the fleeting pleasures of this world, but from the radiant light of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Like the psalmist, we declare that You are a sun and shield, bestowing grace and glory upon all who walk uprightly. May we ever fix our eyes on the Son, the true source of our strength and salvation, and find our delight in Your presence, even in the midst of life's storms. In the name of our Lord Jesus, we pray. Amen.
reflection: I prefer sunny days, but I am not a sun-worshiper. Instead, I'm a worshiper of God's Son, who shines brightly in all who believe in Him whatever the weather. Which kind of worshiper are you? Lasting happiness doesn't come from sunny days but from the Son of God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Teach me Your way, Lord, that I may rely on_

_Your faithfulness; give me an undivided heart,_

_that I may fear your name. _(Ps. 86:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Prayer is not a way of making use of God; prayer

is a way of offering ourselves to God in order that

He should be able to make use of us. It may be that

one of our great faults in prayer is that we talk too

much and listen to little. When prayer is at its highest

we should wait in silence for God's voice to us. We

might call this a "listening prayer," and it is a practice

we nee to develop.

GOD SPEAKS THROUGH HIS WORD--TAKE TIME TO LISTEN.

_ PASTOR AL _
original_reflection_text: Prayer is not a way of making use of God; prayer is a way of offering ourselves to God in order that He should be able to make use of us. It may be that one of our great faults in prayer is that we talk too much and listen to little. When prayer is at its highest we should wait in silence for God's voice to us. We might call this a "listening prayer," and it is a practice we nee to develop. GOD SPEAKS THROUGH HIS WORD--TAKE TIME TO LISTEN.
original_verse_text: Teach me Your way, Lord, that I may rely on Your faithfulness; give me an undivided heart, that I may fear your name.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to know Your will and walk in Your ways. Teach us, O Lord, to listen to Your voice and to meditate on Your Word, that we may understand Your truth and live according to Your perfect plan. May our prayers be a time of offering ourselves to You, that You may use us for Your glory. Speak to us, Lord, and grant us the wisdom and discernment to follow where You lead. Amen.
reflection: Prayer is not a way of making use of God; prayer is a way of offering ourselves to God in order that He should be able to make use of us. It may be that one of our great faults in prayer is that we talk too much and listen too little. When prayer is at its highest, we should wait in silence for God's voice to us. We might call this a “listening prayer,” and it is a practice we need to develop. God speaks through His Word—take time to listen.
subject: The Listening Prayer
verse_text: Teach me Your way, Lord, that I may rely on Your faithfulness; give me an undivided heart, that I may fear your name.
